abstracts.cdata!:
This Third Report of Study of Traffic
            Management in two districts of Lima contains the preliminary
            results of the Traffic Management Plan and has been
            developed with the aim of improving through the
            implementation of short-term measures, the conditions of
            pedestrian and vehicular circulation in the district of
            Barranco. The study includes data collection and processing
            of a traffic management plan to be implemented in the short
            term (one year) from a multi-criteria analysis selection of
            alternatives. This stage of the study will provide
            preliminary results of a comparison of three alternative
            proposals for traffic management plans for the district of
            Barranco. The Study Terms of Reference (TOR) also state that
            the three management plans proposed for comparison are:
            First, Baseline Scenario, corresponding to the current
            situation; Secondly, community proposal to be implemented in
            the short term; Thirdly, Alternative Proposal Consultant.
            The traffic management interventions propose measures
            relating to planning the use of streets for pedestrian and
            vehicular traffic, i.e. planning directions of traffic,
            pedestrian use of the street in whole or in part, or
            periods, use of streets for parking of vehicles; bans on
            operation of certain types of vehicles, and eventually
            proposed works that can be planned, designed and built in a year.
